sentence: How does batman order his iced water? can i get that..just ice
explanation: Ice can refer to frozen water.
first_new_sentence: The ice in my drink is starting to melt.
second_new_sentence: The climber had to navigate carefully over the treacherous ice on the mountain.

sentence: What did the grape say when it got stepped on? nothing...it just let out a little wine.
explanation: Wine can refer to a beverage made from fermented grapes.
first_new_sentence: I have to drive to the store to pick up some wine for dinner.
second_new_sentence: The vines in the garden produce ample wine when harvested.

sentence: What did the turkeys sing on thanksgiving day? god save the kin.
explanation: Kin can refer to family members or relatives.
first_new_sentence: My kin gather every summer for a big family reunion.
second_new_sentence: The dog is part of our kin, considered family by all of us.

sentence: Why did the baker keep going to the atm? he kneaded the dough
explanation: Dough can refer to uncooked bread mixture.

second_new_sentence: The money she saved was referred to as dough in her conversations.
